summary: This is an email from defense attorney Christian Everdell to prosecutors regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email raises concerns about access to discovery materials, missing documents, redactions, and references a Daily Beast article about a search warrant affidavit used to track Maxwell's cellphone.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, raising discovery issues with prosecutors regarding access to materials, missing documents, and redactions.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on the email, likely a colleague of Christian Everdell at Cohen & Gresser LLP involved in Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Ms. Maxwell', the defendant in the case. The email discusses providing discovery materials to her at the MDC prison to prepare her defense.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Produced flight logs that are part of the discovery. The email notes that some pages (Rodgers000001-000027) appear to be missing from the production.

connections.description: Everdell is communicating with prosecutors to secure discovery materials for Maxwell's defense preparation.
Both are attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP, with Cohen copied on the discovery-related email.
Rodgers produced flight logs that are part of the discovery materials in Maxwell's case.

events.title: Discovery Production Agreement
events.description: Prosecutors agreed to create a new hard drive containing the entire discovery production for the defense.

events.title: Hard Drive Provided to Prosecutors
events.description: Defense provided a 4TB hard drive to prosecutors for the purpose of creating the complete discovery production.

events.title: FBI Report Dated
events.description: An FBI report was created on this date. The defense is requesting an unredacted version (Bates SDNY_GM_02050812-14).

events.title: Daily Beast Article Published
events.description: An article referenced a 'newly unsealed court filing' containing a search warrant affidavit for a cell-site simulator used to track Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone before her arrest.

locations: New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office address)
keyFacts: The defense is having significant difficulty accessing discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell, including issues with a non-functional CD, an incomplete hard drive production, and missing document pages.
The defense is requesting an unredacted version of a December 6, 2006 FBI report (Bates SDNY_GM_02050812-14) and a log justifying all redactions in the discovery.
Flight logs produced by David Rodgers appear to be missing pages Rodgers000001 through Rodgers000027.

A Daily Beast article revealed the existence of a search warrant affidavit for a cell-site simulator used to track Maxwell's cellphone prior to her arrest, which the defense was unaware had been unsealed.
The email reveals ongoing procedural disputes and transparency issues between the defense and prosecution regarding the handling and production of evidence.
